head.title: Software using CDK
head.summary: This page contains a list of programs that use (partly) CDK.

section.title: Software using CDK
section.para: This page contains a list of programs that use CDK to some extent. If your software uses CDK and is missing from this list, please send an email to cdk-devel@lists.sf.net.

section.title: HyperDossier
section.para: Intellidos HyperDossier is a light weight web application that collates and cross links scientific data. All the latest information about a particular scientific entity, from a variety of sources may be collated into a single electronic dossier. Hyperlinking between these dossiers creates a web of scientific information that may be readily browsed by scientists.

section.title: JChemPaint
section.para: JChemPaint is a 2D chemical diagram editor like many others and is fully based on CDK.

section.title: Jmol
section.para: Jmol is a 3D chemical animator/viewer. Version 6 to and including 9 use the cdk-core classes for data storage. Later, in the 10 preseries, more efficient Java classes were implemented to allow beter rendering performance. A tight integration with CDK is possible: CDK plugins and IO can be used and the renderer can be used by CDK based software.

section.title: JOELib
section.para: JOELib is a chemical library like CDK itself and is based on the OELib library written in C++. It's licenced GPL, and uses an customized versino of CDK's CML library for reading CML.

section.title: Jumbo
section.para: Jumbo is software aiming at converting full chemical documents (in any format) into Chemical Markup Language, applying chemical perception and conversion in the process if needed.

section.title: NMRShiftDB
section.para: NMRShiftDB is an open-source, open-content database of organic structures and their NMR data. [STE2002].

section.title: Nomen
section.para: Nomen is a IUPAC name parser being developed at the University of Manchester, UK.

section.title: SafeBase(TM)
section.para: SafeBase (TM) is a theragenomics knowledge management system on adverse drug reactions developed by TheraSTrat.

section.title: SENECA
section.para: SENECA is a software package for Computer-Assisted Structure Elucidation (CASE) of organic molecules based on spectroscopic data [STE2001].

section.title: QueryConstructor
section.para: Intellidos QueryConstructor is an ad hoc cross-domain query tool that allows scientists with no knowledge of SQL to build complex queries on complex scientific data.

section.title: XB Edit (Working title)
section.para: XB Edit is an Extreme Blue (tm) internship project currently in progress at IBM Germany Development Lab in Boeblingen near Stuttgart, Germany. XB Edit is supposed grow into a combined 2D/3D editor for chemical structure and uses the CDK for handling the standard chemoinformatical algorithms.
